page.title: 01 Linlithgow
page.content: { }Linlithgow,a very old historic town, is situated about three miles south of the River Forth and about twenty miles West of Edinburgh.The name "Linlithgow" means "Lake in the damp hollow". Today Linlithgow is growing quite fast and now it is a big town with a population of over ten thousand.There have been more houses and schools built in Linlithgow to keep up with the increasing population. Our class carried out a survey of the good and bad points of Linlithgow.Most people criticized the town's lack of recreational and community facilities and also its increasing vandalism.However they did feel that it had a very pleasant environment and a good community spirit and was a good centre for access to both Edinburgh and Glasgow.
